alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Pittsburg; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 11:39PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pushmataha, Haskell, northeastern McIntosh, west central Sequoyah, Latimer, eastern Pittsburg and southeastern Muskogee Counties through 1215 AM CST... At 1139 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Checotah to 3 miles east of Blocker to near Daisy. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Wilburton... Stigler... Clayton... Checotah... Hartshorne... Warner... Quinton... Gore... Porum... Webbers Falls... Red Oak... Whitefield... Kinta... Higgins... Tuskahoma... Stanley... Kiamichi... Lequire... Clayton Lake State Park... Damon... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 262 and 293. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
